alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 8:10PM EST until February 01 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. .Runoff from recent rainfall, along with additional rainfall with crossing low pressure tonight and Sunday, will result in elevated levels along the Ohio River at Pittsburgh through Wednesday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and previous snow melt continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.0 feet early Tuesday morning. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
